intro: Epacris hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's epacris, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its upright, woody stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to white, are often visited by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological significance. Epacris hookeri is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
